alert.note: Alert for Grundy; Will (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 26 at 7:43PM CST until January 27 at 9:15AM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM CST SATURDAY FOR EAST CENTRAL GRUNDY AND SOUTHWESTERN WILL COUNTIES... At 743 PM CST, At 730 PM CST, emergency management and river gauge data indicated re-newed ice jamming near the I-55 bridge, which has caused river levels to quickly rise to 15.5 ft to the east of I-55. Shifting of the ice jam and subsequent rapid break up are are imminent, which will result in potentially life threatening flash flooding downstream of I-55. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding from an ice jam. SOURCE...Emergency management. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of areas near and downstream of the ice jam. Flash flooding will occur from near the Interstate 55 bridge to the confluence with the Illinois River. Sudden shifting of this ice jam as it moves down river may cause rapid rises of water and flooding of property along the banks. Water is expected to rise up to 3-5 feet and will move downstream toward the mouth of the Kankakee River, which may flood roadways and structures along the banks. Flowing ice may damage roadways and structures along the immediate banks of the river. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: A Flash Flood Warning means rapid-onset flooding is imminent. Persons along the lower Kankakee River should take immediate precautions to protect life and property.
